org.apache.juneau.utils

Class MessageBundle

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.ResourceBundle
      • org.apache.juneau.utils.MessageBundle

  • public class MessageBundle
extends ResourceBundle
    Wraps a ResourceBundle to provide some useful additional functionality.
    • Instead of throwing MissingResourceException, the ResourceBundle.getString(String) method will return "{!!key}" if the bundle was not found, and "{!key}" if bundle was found but the key is not in the bundle.
    • A client locale can be set as a ThreadLocal object using the static setClientLocale(Locale) so that client localized messages can be retrieved using the getClientString(String, Object...) method on all instances of this class.
    • Resource bundles on parent classes can be added to the search path for this class by using the addSearchPath(Class, String) method. This allows messages to be retrieved from the resource bundles of parent classes.
    • Locale-specific bundles can be retrieved by using the getBundle(Locale) method.
    • The getString(Locale, String, Object...) method can be used to retrieve locale-specific messages.
    • Messages in the resource bundle can optionally be prefixed with the simple class name. For example, if the class is MyClass and the properties file contains "MyClass.myMessage", the message can be retrieved using getString("myMessage").
    Notes:
    • This class is thread-safe.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageBundle

        public MessageBundle(Class<?> forClass,
                     String bundlePath)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        forClass - The class using this resource bundle.
        bundlePath - The path of the resource bundle to wrap. This can be an absolute path (e.g. "com.foo.MyMessages") or a path relative to the package of the forClass (e.g. "MyMessages" if forClass is "com.foo.MyClass").

    • Method Detail

      • setClientLocale

        public static void setClientLocale(Locale locale)
        Sets the locale for this thread so that calls to getClientString(String, Object...) return messages in that locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - The new client locale.

      • create

        public static final MessageBundle create(Class<?> forClass)
        Constructor.

        When this method is used, the bundle path is determined by searching for the resource bundle in the following locations:

        • [package].ForClass.properties
        • [package].nls.ForClass.properties
        • [package].i18n.ForClass.properties
        Parameters:
        forClass - The class
        Returns:
        A new message bundle belonging to the class.

      • create

        public static final MessageBundle create(Class<?> forClass,
                                         String bundlePath)
        Constructor.

        A shortcut for calling new MessageBundle(forClass, bundlePath).

        Parameters:
        forClass - The class
        bundlePath - The location of the resource bundle.
        Returns:
        A new message bundle belonging to the class.

      • addSearchPath

        public MessageBundle addSearchPath(Class<?> forClass,
                                   String bundlePath)
        Add another bundle path to this resource bundle.

        Order of property lookup is first-to-last.

        This method must be called from the same thread as the call to the constructor. This eliminates the need for synchronization.

        Parameters:
        forClass - The class using this resource bundle.
        bundlePath - The bundle path.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

        public boolean containsKey(String key)
        Overrides:

      • getString

        public String getString(String key,
                        Object... args)
        Similar to ResourceBundle.getString(String) except allows you to pass in MessageFormat objects.
        Parameters:
        key - The resource bundle key.
        args - Optional MessageFormat-style arguments.
        Returns:
        The resolved value. Never null. "{!!key}" if the bundle is missing. "{!key}" if the key is missing.

      • getString

        public String getString(Locale locale,
                        String key,
                        Object... args)
        Same as getString(String, Object...) but allows you to specify the locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale of the resource bundle to retrieve message from.
        key - The resource bundle key.
        args - Optional MessageFormat-style arguments.
        Returns:
        The resolved value. Never null. "{!!key}" if the bundle is missing. "{!key}" if the key is missing.

      • getClientString

        public String getClientString(String key,
                              Object... args)
        Same as getString(String, Object...) but uses the locale specified on the call to setClientLocale(Locale).
        Parameters:
        key - The resource bundle key.
        args - Optional MessageFormat-style arguments.
        Returns:
        The resolved value. Never null. "{!!key}" if the bundle is missing. "{!key}" if the key is missing.

      • findFirstString

        public String findFirstString(String... keys)
        Looks for all the specified keys in the resource bundle and returns the first value that exists.
        Parameters:
        keys - The list of possible keys.
        Returns:
        The resolved value, or null if no value is found or the resource bundle is missing.

        keys - The list of possible keys.

      • swap

        public ObjectMap swap()
        Returns this resource bundle as an ObjectMap.

        Useful for debugging purposes. Note that any class that implements a swap() method will automatically be serialized by calling this method and serializing the result.

        This method always constructs a new ObjectMap on each call.

        Returns:
        A new map containing all the keys and values in this bundle.

      • getBundle

        public MessageBundle getBundle(Locale locale)
        Returns the resource bundle for the specified locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - The client locale.
        Returns:
        The resource bundle for the specified locale. Never null.
